title: Why don’t Trump supporters believe Donald Trump when he says that COVID-19 is “deadly stuff”? - Quora

response.answer_text: but who exactly is saying they don’t? The average death age of people with covid is 82. Anyone aged under 65 has in between a 99.65% and 99.98% chance of survival (CDC). Still, that doesn’t mean they don’t believe it, it just means that they decide based on their situation rather than the state. Also, when Trump got Covid, people made videos by the thousands, if not dozens or hundreds of thousands, wishing Trump well. If i thought Covid was like a cold, i wouldn’t care if my candidate got it.

Because he so often simply lies or changes his mind. If you have “deadly stuff,” you don’t go on joy rides for photo-ops. You don’t arrange a grand entrance back to the White House - and then do a second take. You don’t pretend it’s business as usual by going back to work while still infectious. In short, the little President who cried wolf, has called wolf once too often.
